name: The English Market
description: A historic indoor food market operating since 1788, known for its fresh produce, meats, and traditional Irish foods.

name: Cork City Gaol Museum
address: Convent Avenue, Sunday's Well, Cork, Ireland
description: A 19th-century prison turned museum, offering a fascinating glimpse into Cork’s past with lifelike figures and exhibitions.

name: Elizabeth Fort
description: A 17th-century star-shaped fort with panoramic views of the city and free entry to explore Cork’s military history.

name: St. Fin Barre’s Cathedral
description: A striking Gothic Revival cathedral completed in 1879, famous for its ornate stone carvings, spires, and stained glass.

name: Blackrock Castle
description: A riverside castle built in the 16th century, now home to a science centre, observatory, and popular café.

name: Fota Wildlife Park
description: A family-friendly wildlife park where animals roam in open spaces, featuring giraffes, cheetahs, and monkeys close to their natural habitat.

name: Shandon Bells
address: Church Street, Shandon, Cork City, Ireland
description: Climb the historic tower, ring the famous bells, and enjoy panoramic views over Cork’s skyline.

name: Fitzgerald’s Park
description: Riverside park with gardens, sculptures, a playground, and seasonal events—right beside Cork Public Museum.
